graph_title: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
indicator_name: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
SDG_TARGET: Target 2.1: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations,  including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 2.1.1: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES) - reported by county
STAT_CONC_DEF:
## Definition: This indicator provides internationally-comparable estimates of the proportion of the population facing moderate or severe difficulties in accessing food.  The Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES) produces a measure of the severity of food insecurity experienced by individuals or households, based on direct interviews. 
## Modification: Alabama states Food insecurity is limited or uncertain. availability of nutritionally adequate and safe foods or limited or uncertain ability to acquire acceptable foods  in socially acceptable ways.
